gurmukhi: imlMq dwNq Gws lY rr`C sbd aucrM ]ibrwD dwnvM juJXo su h`iQ rwm inrmlM ]322]
transliteration: Milant Daant Ghaas Lai Rarachchh Sabad Oucharan|| Biraadh Daanavan Jujhyo Su Hatth(i) Raam Nirmalan||322||
translation: The demons inimical to Ram, taking the blades of grass in their teeth, have uttered the words “Protect us” and in this way the demons named Viradh has been killed.322.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky rwmvqwr kQw ibrwD dwnv bDh ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Raamavtaar Kathaa Biraadh Daanav Badhah||
translation: End of the description of killing of the demon VIRADH in Ramavtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.
Now begins the description regarding entry in the forest :

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD mwr ibrwD kau bn my Dsy insMg ]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Maar Biaraadh Kau Ban Me Dhase Nisan||
translation: In this way killing Viradh, Ram and Lakshman penetrated further into the forest.

gurmukhi: su kib sXwm ieh ibiD kihXo rGubr ju`D pRsMg ]323]
transliteration: Su Kab(i) Syaam Eh Bidh(i) Kahiyo Raghoubar Juddh Prasan||323||
translation: The poet Shyam has described this incident in the above-mentioned way.323.

gurmukhi: irK Agsq Dwm ]gey rwj rwm ]Duj Drm Dwm ]sIAw sihq bwm ]324]
transliteration: Rikh Agadt Dhaam|| Gad Raaj Raam|| Dhuj Dharam Dhaam|| Seeaa Sahit Baam||324||
translation: The king Ram went to the went to the hermitage of the sage Agastya and Sita was with him, who is the abode of Dharma.324.

gurmukhi: lK rwm bIr ]irK dIn qIr ]irp srb cIr ]hir srb pIr ]325]
transliteration: Lakh Raam Beer|| Rikh Deen Teer|| Rip Sarab Cheer|| Har(i) Sarab Peer||325||
translation: Seeing the great hero Ram, the sage advised him to kill all the enemies and remove the anguish of all the people.325.

gurmukhi: irK ibdw kIn ]AwisKw dIn ]duq rwm cIn ]mun mn pRbIn ]326]
transliteration: Rikh Bidaa Keen|| Aasikhaa Deen|| Dout Raam Cheen|| Mounndman Prabeen||326||
translation: In this way giving his blessing, the sage recognizing the beauty and power of Ram dexterously in his mind, bade him farewell.326.

gurmukhi: pRB BRwq sMig ]sIA sMg surMg ]qij icMq AMg ]Ds bn insMg ]327]
transliteration: Prabh Bhraat San(i)|| Seea San Suran|| Taj(i) Chint An|| Dhas Ban Nisan||327||
translation: Ram, alongwith his winsome wife Sita and his brother moved fearlessly in the dense forest, forsaking all his anxieties.327.

gurmukhi: Dr bwn pwn ]kit kis kiRpwn ]Buj br Ajwn ]cl qIrQ nwn ]328]
transliteration: Dhar Baan Paan|| Kat(i) Kas(i) Kridaan|| Bhuj Bar Ajaan|| Chal Tiraath Naan||328||
translation: With his sword tied by the waist and holding the arrows in him hand, the long-armed heroes started for the bath at pilgrim-stations.328.

gurmukhi: godwvr qIr ]gey sihq bIr ]qj rwm cIr ]kIA suc srIr ]329]
transliteration: Godaavar Teer|| Gad Sahit Beer|| Taj Raam Cheer|| Keea Souch Dareer||329||
translation: He reached on the bank of Godavari alongwith his heroic brother and there Ram put off his clothes and took a bath, thus cleansing his body.329.­
